text: Meh... I tried it and won't go back. Service was very slow (took about 2:30), which was fine for that night since I was in no hurry. The moules frites were ok, they weren't bad but I prefer the ones I make. I tasted the crepe and thought it was good.   They seemed seriously understaffed and the people behind us really were flipping out because of it.  I like the decor though, it's looks nice.

Bistro au service sympathique et au cachet original, situé au coeur du Campus de l'UdM. Manger un burger "Gros Dégueulasse" en écoutant un film français noir et blanc qui se passe pendant l'Occupation a un certain charme.  Ceci dit,quand  le charme du décor est passé, on met le nez dans son assiette et on est un peu déçu. Primo, les frites:  ça ruine pas les coûts d'exploitation d'un restaurant et ça rend les clients heureux. Alors mettez-en plus qu'une paume de main. Deuxio, la qualité des condiments du burger: le bacon qui a refroidi sur la plaque, on ne le passe pas aux clients, même sur l'heure du rush.  Je ne veux pas être trop sévère car ma collègue a bien apprécié sa crêpe, dont la portion avait l'air plus équilibrée. Mais pour une facture totale qui dépasse 50$ pour deux, dans un bistro dont la clientèle est avant tout étudiante, on est en droit de s'attendre à mieux...
Les oeufs mimosas étaient juste des oeufs mayo... Mon tartare de boeuf était bon mais mais il manquait un petit quelque chose.

I read the other reviews that said how the food here is overpriced. How the soup came with a fly. How the entrees just didn't taste good. But all I wanted was a beer, just a beer, how could they get that wrong? The server was friendly, got me a beer menu, and I got a beer on tap - great. But when it came, there were TWO flies in the beer! Oh well, napkin-ed them out, still a good beer.  Two stars instead of one because of the beer selection.

As my husband said, "my favourite part of the restaurant, was the name".  Very disappointed to say the food really did not live up to my expectations.   This is meant to be a French brasserie, but the food was a far cry from being at a French standard, unless you count the Parisian tourist traps.   We ordered the peach & prosciutto entree, followed by the bavette and the lobster ravioli. Everything was over salted, drowning in butter and cream with way too much garlic, not to mention the overall quality of the meat was poor.   I was so excited to try this place, which makes it that much more disappointing. The total came up to $100, which was clearly not on par with the value of the food.   On a positive note, the ambiance was very nice and certainly did remind me of a French bistro.
Delicious French onion soup and fish and chips. The wait staff was very nice and love the atmosphere here. Definitely a must see and experience.

Le restaurant a belle allure, le choix est correct, la cuisine n'est pas mal du tout. Rien de bien original, mais on retrouve plusieurs classiques des bistros français et leur exécution est très correcte.  Cependant, le service et l'ambiance sont à revoir. On a attendu longtemps avant d'avoir les menus, malgré que les serveurs nous aient vus et n'aient pas l'air surchargés du tout (resto à moitié vide ce soir-là). Ils ne connaissaient pas bien leur menu et n'avaient aucun conseil à offrir (quant aux digestifs, l'un d'eux ne savait pas de quoi je voulais parler !).  Également, l'établissement se veut un peu élégant (et le tarif reflète ça) mais les serveurs n'avaient pas une attitude élégante du tout. Très décontractés, trop même (ambiance "je suis ton copain"). Il faut savoir ce qu'on veut : resto du coin, ou ambiance un peu classe ? Aussi, la musique était trop forte, ce n'est pas une boîte de nuit...  Bref, ça a du potentiel, surtout dans le quartier, mais il y a des choses à corriger.

Le décor me rappelle les brasseries parisiennes. Côté menu, j'ai bien aimé  mon duo de tartares, buf et saumon tout comme mon gâteau à la banane et fromage de chèvre.  J'y retourne.  Le quartier avait bien besoin cet ajout

A disappointing french brasserie experience. You get the french brasserie name and the french brasserie decor. You definitely get a better service than in any french brasserie but the food is really not at a good standard. We had a variety of main, from the paté chinois to the bavette, the fish and chips, the croque-monsieur and the salmon salad. Everything was bland and limited (i.e., you had the strict minimum on your plate). Then, we found a hair in one of the plate... When you know that the mains are around 20-25$, you expect better quality, better taste and better food.

Un bon bistro sur Côte-des-Neiges avec une jolie terrasse, une carte qui comprend beaucoup de choix: poisson, viande, crêpe, poutines et autres; sans compter la table d'hôte et le plat du jour qui apportent quelque chose de nouveau chaque jour.  Ils servent des cocktails dans de gros pots maçons, le meilleur endroit dans le quartier pour en siroter un sur une terrasse. Le patron est souvent là, assez proche de sa clientèle, surtout celle qui est régulière. Les serveurs sont attentionnés et sérieux.  Seul point négatif, les gros groupes (+ de 10 personnes) prennent du temps à être servis.
A great hamburger "le gros dégueulasse" Awesome tartine brandade de morue Lovely French crêpes

Très décevant comme restaurant qui pourtant est très charmant! La première fois que j'y suis allée c'était bon, cependant la deuxième fois, j'ai commandé les moules&frites à volonté. Les moules n'étaient pas bien lavées et ne goûtaient rien. Le service était extrêmement long. Pour le rapport qualité/prix, je vous déconseille!

Very disappointing experience. First of all : we've been there for a while and did not get the menu, but lucky one employee was at the nearest table (he wasnt working this day) and was nice enough to go get menus for us without us asking. Our waiter wasn't paying any attention l. We got the food pretty fast, but he forgot to bring water for the table and my boyfriend had to ask him twice. We did not leave any tip as the service was crappy and the waiter had the audacity to stop us on our way out to question us about this, ARE YOU FOR REAL? Anyways I had the crab cake with salad it was good but could have been better.

Les gens sont trop durs avec ce Resto. Le menu est super intéressant... Je suis français... Je sais de quoi je parle... On y trouve des classiques et plusieurs: tartares, boudin noir, rognons etc.... Le service est agréable, l'endroit pas trop bruyant (défaut de beaucoup de restos à Montréal). Alors oui les vins au verre sont un peu cher... Mais les huîtres à 1$, les moules à volonté à 25$ etc... Compensent largement. A essayer, ne vous fiez pas à ceux qui ont mis des sales notes.... Ils n'y connaissent rien.

Je suis tombée sous le charme des Tontons Flingueurs principalement pour son décor, ce style petit bistro à la française et rétro me fait sourire! L'ornement et les chaises en bois, les tabourets au comptoir, les photos en noir et blanc, le tout accompagné d'un fond de musique fait en sorte qu'on a l'impression de voyager dans le temps!   Pour ce qui est de la nourriture maintenant, j' ai testé deux fois leurs crêpes salées et j'ai été agréablement surprise, c'était bien bon! Par contre, pour être objective, mon amie quant à elle, a pris la salade de chèvre et a été assez déçue! Leur salade était plutôt digne d'une salade d'accompagnement, d'ailleurs j'avais quasiment la même avec ma crêpe et ça manquait un peu de fromage de chèvre, pour le prix!  Malgré tout, j'y retournerai sûrement à l'occasion, peut-être pas pour leurs salades mais pour tester l'un de leur tartare ou poutine un peu "gastronomique".
Great ambience, food is good but overpriced. $13 for French onion soup is ridiculous. Won't return-you can find better bang for buck elsewhere.

Vive the special 1$ oyster from 4 to 7 pm! Nevertheless, you have to buy a drink to enjoy the special. I bought a dozen oysters and I got myself a glass of pinot white wine to compliment my meal. The total came in at 27.35$ and it is 30$ including tips.   First of all, the decoration is nice, I will give points to that. Second, the oysters were NOT fresh AT ALL. I had better ones from metro's seafood section. The white wine tastes okay. Third, it is expensive as hell the food they offered... I paid 10$ for a 5-ounce glass of white wine. Appetizers are all 10$ and up. Main dishes are all in the 20$ range.   I have never been to France but the menu does NOT look like French food, it looks like it got themselves confused from different countries. Which country? Italy, UK, Quebec, Portugal... French... Some of the food looks French.  Quality is not great but I think the service was good.

I've been looking forward to visiting this place for a while to benefit from their 1$ oyster special. At first, I was very impressed by their decor. I've been walking by this place for decades and I would've never known that there could have been such a beautiful place tucked in here right under my nose. Unfortunately, that's where my compliments cease.  The food I've had at this place has likely been one of the worst in Montreal. Gordon Ramsay has a saying where the first thing he tries when he gets to a restaurant are its crab cakes, as that's a sure tell sign of the kitchen's competence. For 25$, I would have expected more than the two sorry raw mashed potato dough balls they presented me. To complement it, they had a cheap salad with goop as dressing. The 1$ oysters were okay.   While I was eating, the table next to me told me they felt sorry for us, as they had ordered the same thing and their food was terrible. The waiter was new and didn't really do anything about the situation, even after us having vocalized our discontent. Strongly recommend you take your patronage elsewhere.

My favorite thing was the name....that is all.   No, but seriously the service and atmosphere are nice. We felt like we were tucked in a small brasserie in Paris.   The bad...the meal unfortunately nowhere close to the dedicate flavors I would expect from a French restaurant. The ravioli was very garlic heavy and the Bavette was very salty. It was just not very good. For context it was 9:30 when we arrived and the kitchen closed at 10:00 so maybe it wasn't there best night because they wanted us out, I'm not sure.  The reason I gave it 2 stars versus 1 star is it has potential and maybe they had a bad night. Otherwise I would give it 1 star. If you go, play it safe with drinks and sides as snacking food versus a dinner.

Très désappointée. Les croûtons de la soupe de poisson étaient les croûtons cheap d'épicerie. L'aïoli était orange fluo, mais sans goûter le saffran... La salade fruits de mer était faite de veux mesclun flétri!!!    Très cher pour la piètre qualité.
